channel.title: Axo Core shows no signs of life anymore
channel.description:
Hey everybody, I was breadboarding a small circuit with a transistor, pwm and vdd/gnd pins and an external power supply to drive a motor and suddenly my board turned off. Now I do not have any Leds responding when connecting a power supply, the board does not show up in the patcher, not even in DFU mode. I checked voltages in some places on the board and it all seems fine, +5V is giving me +5V and 3,3V is good too. IC1 seems quite hot though, as well as IC2.
There is no signs of damage on the board…
The only thing that I believe could have happened is a reverse voltage going up to VDD and GND pins while I was breadboarding (maybe the 9V external supply?). Could that damage the board beyond reparability? How can I be sure that it is officially deceased?
Pretty bummed as the cores are quite rare nowadays and I use them a lot for my live…
